bibl.title: Moy Wah v. J. C. Drake.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Wash- ington Western Division
In the matter of the application of Moy Wah for a writ of habeas corpus

Leon Gum, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says that he has been a resident of Portland Oregon for five years last past and for the last three years has been a member of the mer- cantile firm of Gum Wing Chung and Co of which firm of above named Moy Wah is a member said firm being deal in Chinese and Japanese wares and other goods at 108 Fifth Street and he says that the said Moy Wah was a member of said firm and a partner merchant before this deponent because a partner mer as aforesaid and not said Moy Wah is still a portion in said firm
and has an interest therein as such partner in the sum of $1200 00, one thousand two hundred dollars

Deponent further says that he is well and personally ac- quainted with said Moy Wah and knows that he was on or about the 22nd day of January 1892 the said Moy Wah left the City of Portland for China with the intention of working pe of gu for this said firm and also to visit his relatives and that he so went with the approval and consent of his said firm and that he returned or alli to portion on the steamship Victoria.

That this deponent as portion of said Moy Wah cause to Lacome to appear before the United States Court to facts and the facts recited in the petition of said Moy Wah the same being to deponents on knowledge; that he has seen the said Moy Wah and recognized him in the charge of the United States Marshal and recognizes and knows
him to the his said partiner Moy Wah

Deponent Lench ali a card of the said firm of which Moy Wah is a member as aforesaid and deponent further declares that said Moy Wah is a good honest bonafide merchant of the United States and has been such for more than thtree years last past to deponent and personal knowledge and for five years of aforesaid and is still a partiner of said firm
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 4 June 1895
